channel.title: Summoning Dismiss
channel.description:
Well, I've been working on a Summoning skill, just to really kill time, and to have fun and see how far i can probably get. But I'm pretty confused with dismiss.
Well, pretty much, I'm wondering if anyone can give me a hint to actually make it dismiss there NPC, like, I'm pretty clueless how to actually do this and make this ONLY affect there NPC they summoned.
Thanks if you can help :).

item.title: Summoning Dismiss
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

maybe not “kill.Summon” maybe just “killSummon”

who knows, real summoning with BoB hasn’t been added to 317s I think

Read full topic

item.title: Summoning Dismiss
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

Natey:

That’s what I tried to write out, but it may be a bit more in depth, and maybe some client-sided editing, anyways good luck

Haha, yea i know:p, But it won’t work like that.

public void dismissSummon(); // Void
if.playerSummoningMonster = 1; // Checking if he or she summoned the npc.
kill.Summon = true; // kills the npc.
dropItems = true; // Drops the items.
}

As you can see, i need the “kill.summon” method, thats pretty much it. The rest i can figure out, and thanks ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Summoning Dismiss
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

[quote=“Natey, post:2, topic:337822”]you might have to make a new void (sort of like hail) that when you do the command IE: ::smnkill or ::dismiss that it calls for the void

so maybe

public void dismissSummon();
if.playerSummoningMonster = 1;
kill.Summon = true;
ifSummonBoB = true; &&dropBoBItem = true;
dropItems = true;
}

Or something like that, I’d have to write out a whole summoning base by myself to do it.[/quote]

I already know this. I mean a void that’ll actually KILL there npc, and only theres. Like for example, when you dismiss in runescape the npc dismisses, dies/disappears, :x. But thanks for trying :).

Read full topic

item.title: Summoning Dismiss
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

you might have to make a new void (sort of like hail) that when you do the command IE: ::smnkill or ::dismiss that it calls for the void

so maybe

public void dismissSummon();
if.playerSummoningMonster = 1;
kill.Summon = true;
ifSummonBoB = true; &&dropBoBItem = true;
dropItems = true;
}

Or something like that, I’d have to write out a whole summoning base by myself to do it.

Read full topic
